data.title: TypeScript realtime lint for all files
data.body:
- VSCode Version:
1.8.1
- OS Version:
Windows 7

Simply, when I make breaking changes to my files, VScode do not detects at all the erros on other files until I open those files. I would like for VScode to check for problems on all files (including closed ones, if possible) when I make changes.

For example, if I have a module called `mod` and other files import something from the `mod`, if I rename `mod` to `mod2`, VScode do not shows error on all the files, but some of them, and sometimes after some time has passed.

And if I rename it back to `mod`, the errors are still shown and I have to reedit the file for the error to dissapear.
![](http://i.imgur.com/fVfaHTG.gif)

Seems that the checker is kinda chunky.

I do not compile my .ts files when I save them, as I load them directly with `ts-node`.

data.title: Opening from CLI (code <file>) opens last session without new file on fresh start
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: macOS 10.12.2

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Make sure, Visual Studio Code is stopped completely (Quit)
2. Type `code <file>`
3. Observe that
  * Your last session is opened
  * `file`is not part of that session
4. Type `code <file>`again (don't quit Visual Studio ode)
5. Your file is now opened
 
What should happen:
1. Regardless if quit or not
2. Type `code <file>
3. Your last session is opened and `file` is part of that session.

data.title: Telemetry questions
data.body:
Hi!

I have a few questions related with telemetry, embedded into VSCode:

1. We know that VSCode have telemetry, but when disabled, is it stays completely silent or sends "opt-out" signal to servers? Atom works like this, until telemetry package is completely removed (as they says, not tested by myself).

2. May be it will be a good idea to ask user about "opt-in" for telemetry, instead of "opt-out" by default? When VSCode starts for first time?

3. Is packages have ability to gather data and send it to devs? May be it will be good idea to have ability to completely mute ANY telemetry communications between VSCode/Packages and dev servers? For those, who concerned about their privacy?

4. What exactly telemetry gathers and sends?

data.title: Markdown Incorrect Colorization of Fenced Code Blocks
[Proxy] Use the same service for exploring extensions and for installing them
data.body:
Hi,

This is in relation to https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/17574, https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/17397, https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/17360.

Like I said in those issues, I remarked that looking for extensions on the marketplace and installing them don't use the same "piece of code". And indeed, listing extensions and their properties is done by the main process which has access to ExtensionManagementService. The latter doesn't seem to care about the config "http.proxy", but can nonetheless use the default system proxy. So far, so good.

However, when "install" is pressed on the screen, the IExtensionManagementService is resolved as ExtensionManagementChannelClient which will call via ipc the Shared process which will finally call ExtensionManagementService. What's astonishing is that the same piece of code now cares about "http.proxy" and when it's not set, it cannot use the default system proxy.

**TL;DR**
This PR aims at fixing the issues with http proxy or otherwise be a starting point üòÅ 
To test that the behaviours of searchs & installs are different you can add the following user setting: 

```json
{
    "http.proxy": "http://dummy.proxy:8080"
}
```

What do you think? Is the fix proposed here the right thing to do or does it hide another bug?

data.title: With multiple cursors, autocompletion suggests what you're already typing
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1

Steps to Reproduce:

* Create document (EDIT @egamma `Plain Text`) with this content:

```
foobar
hey hey
```

* Use Cmd-D to mark both instances of `hey`
* Press `f`
* First autocompletion will be `f`, not `foobar`. This is because it matches itself.
* Press `o`. Autocompletion dropdown disappears. This is due to #4911.
* Press `o`. First autocompletion will `foo`, not `foobar`.
* And so it goes.

In short, it never makes sense for autocompletion to match something you're already in the process of typing.

data.title: Files don't open on double click
data.body:

- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Double click a php/css/js file 
2. Observe that the program opens with "untitled.text"

Although the program opens via right click - both folders and individual files and also using "Control-O",  double-clicking a file in Windows file-manager doesn't open a file and instead just opens "untitled.txt". This is useful to have if I need to edit a remote file using an FTP manager such as Filezilla.

data.title: Directory tree indent guides in File Explorer
data.body:
It's hard to navigate through project with complex directory structure.

Much better to look at something like this:

```
‚îú‚îÄ app
|  ‚îî‚îÄ main.js
‚îú‚îÄ src
|  ‚îú‚îÄ main.ts
|  ‚îî‚îÄ tsconfig.json
‚îî‚îÄ package.json
```

Instead of this:

```
  app
    main.js
  src
    main.ts
    tsconfig.json
  package.json
```

data.title: Increase the space for tabs
data.body: When i am using vscode with file icons activated on my 13' Macbook, i quickly get a problem with the number of tabs actually visibles. Especially for long file names in my project : This is annoying for angular projects with every file named "file.**component**.ts" or "file.**service**.ts". What i suggest is two things : # **First** it could be great to adding a config in settings.json to allow the display of tabs another potential way, here is a suggestion when the screen is not split : By moving this bar just behind after the code of the title bar : I could be awesome, and i'm not sur we can do thing like that with an extension. # **Second** It could be possible to add a filter on text size for tabs, or a way to limit the size with a [css ellipsis](https://css-tricks.com/snippets/css/truncate-string-with-ellipsis/). Thanks to consider. David B.

data.title: VS Code allows external file changes to overwrite current file state

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.8.1 (ee428b0eead68bf0fb99ab5fdc4439be227b6281, 2016-12-19T14:49:23.350Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.3.9600
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|xml|DotJoshJohnson|1.6.1|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.6.1|
|qub-msbuild|qub|0.5.0|

---

As noted by several people at http://stackoverflow.com/a/30083688/8151 I've had numerous experiences where file changes triggered by source control activity have overwritten the current state of a buffer. In one case this has caused the loss of a great deal of work but since I realized the behavior it's been more of a (significant) annoyance.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a file.
2. Make a few changes
3. Trigger a source control event that overwrites or deletes the file on disk.
4. Depending on the type of file changes, VS Code either silently updates the buffer or pops a warning saying the file can no longer be found and offering to create it. My experiences have generally been with Perforce as the source control provider, but others in the stackoverflow question seem to have experienced it with git as well.

data.title: Copy/Cut and Paste are broken
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 / Ubuntu 14

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Type some lines of text:
```
aaaaa
bbbbb
ccccc
```
2. Select `bbbbb` and copy/cut it
3. Delete all lines with `shift+del` _(arrow up, shift+del x3)_
4. Paste what you got on clipboard

Found result:
```
ccccc

```

Expected result:
```
bbbbb
```

This is so frustrating while coding.

data.title: Feature Request: Save language set on hot exit
data.body: Currently when closing unsaved tabs with hot exit, the programming language applied for those tabs will be gone and code will display with no color. Please add the feature to keep language set on hot exit

data.title: WorkspaceConfiguration.update doesn't works inside deactivate method
data.body:
I'm developing an extension for vscode.

I want to save configuration value when vscode closed.
I tried to call `WorkspaceConfiguration.update` inside `deactivate()` of `extension.ts`, but the value seems not to be updated.

Is this a bug, or in the specifications?
Is there any other way to handle vscode closed event?

```typescript
// this method is called when your extension is deactivated
export function deactivate() {
    vscode.workspace.getConfiguration().update("configuration-key", value, true)
}
```

- VSCode Version: 1.8
- OS Version: Windows 10 Anniversarry Update

data.title: Hover for method signatures too aggressive
data.body:
1. debugViews.ts: 316, start typing the following line

 ```javascript	
this.toDispose.push(this.debugService.getViewModel
```

Notice how the hover help appears for push and never goes away. I understand that I am still in the arguments of the push method but for me as a user this is very irritiating - especially since I know how to use the push method of an array.
Not sure how to best improve this - but I would be happy if I could at least disable this hover help which never helps me but alwasy gets in my way.
We could maybe hide it when intelli-sense appears - since that is a clear signal that the user is being focussed on something else atm.

![screen shot 2016-12-23 at 10 44 18](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1926584/21451165/2df78844-c8fd-11e6-9a52-555f46301ab1.png)
